title: Natural Habitat
name: Natural Habitat
description:
A Map by Oleander

Animals in the city

I've been fascinated by the wildlife (including feral cats and dogs) in the big city. Eventually I will pull out my camera and attempt to add picts to this map.

properties.name: Beluga Whale
properties.description: Posted by Oleander4311 Main Street manayunk PAA Beluga Whale appeared in the Delaware and Schuylkill Rivers in April 2005. There was such an uproar that there was a local bakery that saw an increase in income due to their Beluga Whale cookies. The riverways are clean enough to attract a whale. Weeeee! I suppose there\'s always reason to celebrate when the waters aren\'t so toxic that they kill all living creatures within them...well, toxic anymore.

properties.name: Deer
properties.description: Posted by Oleander city line ave Bala cynwyd paA deer (no antlers - I think it was Doe, but it was pretty far away). It had a pretty red tinge to it\'s hide but it was also sunrise so it may have been the sun.

properties.name: Finch
properties.description: Posted by Oleander 9th street and market street philadelphia paIt was a tiny injured bird constantly in danger of being stepped on. People kept looking at it and stepping around it at the last minute. Several couples stopped and stared as if it were a strange freak of nature and they could hardly comprehend it\'s existance. I realized I could not leave it where I found it, so I took my newly purchased jeans out of a plastic bag, caught the bird, smuggled it into a local department store, bought a few items so that I could carry it home, and it \'flew\' away as I was trying to put it into the box. It was more like a desperate flutter/glide/fall over the side of a railing, but it was gone and i could not help it.

properties.name: Kaikoura
properties.description: Posted by KclamaMore of my photos in New Zealand.

properties.name: Possum
properties.description: Posted by Oleander59th and overbrook philadelphia paHiding under the bushes, pressed up against the red brick of a house, and eyeing me warily, I initially mistook it for a giant rat. Like most of the animals I\'ve seen in this city, it was neither as clean nor as healthy as I\'ve seen in the same species outside of the city. It gave me a shock in the last light of day and i suspect it felt the same way about me.

properties.name: Possum in the Tree
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Huntington Beach, CAI spotted a possum in the tree, smack in the middle of business offices. It was weird to see it just sitting up there. I couldn\'t resist taking a snapshot - although it looks somewhat annoyed by me.

properties.name: Raccoon
properties.description: Posted by Oleander 4721 baltimore avenue philadelphia paAn unusually pale Raccoon scurried out of an alley, past the garbage cans in that alley, and across the street. It ducked under a car and disappeared. It was clearly a raccoon, but I have never seen one with fur that grey-white before.

properties.name: River Otter in the Schuylkill River
properties.description: Posted by Oleander17th street and market street philadelphia paBig news in April of 2005 - a River Otter was spotted near a fish ladder in the Schuylkill! Everyone on the news was cheering away because it was possible for wildlife to live in the Philadelphia water! For some reason I couldn\'t quite get over this nasty feeling of unease that this was something people had reason to be REALLY happy about...A river so polluted that it\'s to toxic for a river otter to live (or, at least, find food) is...disturbing.

properties.name: Rock Doves (AKA: Squab or Pigeons)
properties.description: Posted by Oleander 30th street and market street philadelphia paWhile waiting for one of the SEPTA trains you can look up into the roof over the platform and see a large balloon with a target-like image on it\'s side. This is a tool for scaring away birds. It\'s supposed to frighten all non-birds-of-prey. It amuses me to see it up there, spotted with bird poop, obviously not working. The reason it does not work is because it\'s built to imitate the markings of a bird of prey. However, the Squab in the train station have never seen, much less been attacked by, a hawk or an owl. So, the big balloon with the taget on it\'s side is just that - a big balloon with a target on it\'s side. A couple of hunters using trained hawks to reduce the rock dove population would be far more affective.

properties.name: Seagulls
properties.description: Posted by Oleander30th street and market st philadelphia paThey will sit on the railing behind the busstop and wait for food to be dropped or tossed. I threw donut peices over the railing and they cuaght them midair. The most interesting thing about them is they way they just sit on the railing, all in a row, and wait. No agressive begging (that I\'ve seen).

properties.name: Siu Lek Yuen Hill 小瀝源山旁
properties.description: Posted by Kclama  Wing Dance on Vimeo Another Jumping Friend on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo My home is located here, with high-rise buildings by the hill side. It is quite typical in Hong Kong because flat lands are very limited here. I really love this place with the convenience of all the shops near-by. And, at the same time, I can enjoy birding or bugging with a 5-10 min walks. In fact, I found more than 20 types of birds, more than 10 types of butterflies and many other little insects at the areas near-by. Enjoy the urban wildlife. :D Also, my other photos there. Birds ===== Barn Swallow Black Drongo Black Kite Black-collared Starling Blue Magpie Chinese Bulbul Collared Scops Owl Common Kingfisher Common Magpie Common Tailorbird Crested Goshawk Daurian Redstart Great Tit Japanese White-eye Large-billed Crow Masked Laughingthrush Olive-backed Pipit Orange-bellied Leafbird Oriental Magpie Robin Red-whiskered Bulbul Scaly-breasted Munia Spotted Dove Yellow-bellied Prinia Insects ===== Ant Cicada Crimson Dropwing Grasshopper Great Mormon Great Orange Tip Jumping Spider Moth Staff Sergeant
